item.title: Window Functions in SQL
item.description: Window functions are a type of function in SQL that allow you to perform calculations across a set of rows related to the current row, called a “window,” without collapsing the result set. They are used to perform aggregate calculations (like sum, average, count) and ranking operations (like row number, rank) within a specific partition or window of data. Syntax Types of Window Functions: There are a few common window functions you might encounter:
